newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil's 1996 trade gap seen up to $5 bln-official.
newsitem.headline: Brazil's 1996 trade gap seen up to $5 bln-official.

text.p: Brazil's trade deficit in 1996 should reach between $4.5 billion and $5 billion, said the head of the primary commodities department at the Industry and Commerce Ministry.

Up to October, the trade deficit totalled $2.9 billion and the estimate is for deficits of about $1 billion each in November and December, department secretary Mauricio Assis told an international wheat conference in Rio de Janeiro.
Exports this year are expected to total $48 billion while imports are seen reaching $53 billion, he said.
The long-term goal is for the government to balance its trade books, but deficits are likely to continue in 1997 and 1998, he added.
-- Caroline Bulloch, Rio de Janeiro newsroom 5511 507 4151
